intro: Anthorrhiza mitis, commonly known as the slender root herb, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in grassland habitats. Anthorrhiza mitis is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in local herbal remedies.
